title: Build entry / Play screen
description: Simple entry: player taps Play (or similar) and proceeds. No lobby, no room codes, no other players.

title: Build single dater selection for session
description: At session start, select one dater from a pool (e.g. 5–6). Can be first, random, or simple picker; debug menu optional.

title: Build Match screen
description: Screen before date: show today's dater with picture, age, gender, occupation, 1–2 hobbies. Single button: Start date.

title: Build debug menu for dater selection
description: Dev-only (or feature-flagged) way to choose which of 5–6 daters is "today's" date for testing.

title: Build dater profiles (5–6 daters)
description: Define dater schema and 5–6 profiles: name, archetype, description, backstory, values, idealPartner, dealbreakers, stats, quirk, talkingTraits, etc. (Align with design doc and existing daters.js structure if reusing.)

title: Build hidden dater values (loves, likes, dislikes, dealbreakers)
description: At game start, generate or load per-dater hidden values; use them for sentiment and LLM context.

title: Source Match screen stats from dater data
description: Age, gender, occupation, hobbies, picture on Match screen come from the selected dater profile.

title: Build dater response pipeline (LLM)
description: Build prompt from dater personality, conversation history, compatibility, and player answer; call LLM; return dater line only (no avatar line). Same conceptual flow as current getDaterResponseToPlayerAnswer / getDaterResponseToJustification.

title: Build visible vs inferred handling
description: Classify player answer as visible (physical) vs non-visible (personality); visible = dater reacts to what they "see"; non-visible = dater infers from context.

title: Build reaction intensity and "stuck on date"
description: Apply 2–3× intensity for big reveals; dater cannot leave the date; sentiment-driven tone per design.

title: Build sentiment and value matching
description: Classify reactions into loves/likes/dislikes/dealbreakers; drive from hidden dater values and player content (e.g. checkAttributeMatch-style logic).

title: Build Justify mechanic
description: When dater reacts strongly negatively, show Justify step: player submits one follow-up; dater reacts again via LLM. No timer.

title: Build 5-factor compatibility
description: Implement physicalAttraction, similarInterests, similarValues, similarTastes, similarIntelligence with activation and weighting (physical higher at start, equalize over time). Drop lowest factor; compute overall 0–100.

title: Compatibility updates only on dater reaction
description: Change compatibility only when the dater has reacted and sentiment/factor logic runs; not on player submit alone.

title: Build compatibility reason in UI
description: Show brief reason (e.g. "+5 interests") when score changes; clear after delay.

title: Build wrap-up and results screen
description: End-of-date compatibility calculation and results screen (breakdown, outcome) per design.

title: Build date flow: exactly 6 rounds, no timers
description: Date = 6 rounds. Each round: game shows Date Question → player types answer → submit → dater reacts. Advance when reaction is done; no countdown timers.

title: Build game-asked Date Questions
description: Pool of date questions; game (system/narrator) asks one per round at random (or by round index). Dater does not ask the question.

title: Build player text input (mobile)
description: Primary input = text. Player types on phone keyboard and submits. Mobile-first.

title: Dater-only dialogue
description: Only the dater speaks. No avatar lines; no getAvatarDateResponse. Justify remains: one follow-up from player, dater reacts again.

title: Build date scene UI
description: Layout: Date Question visible, text input, dater reply and portrait/expression. Suited for mobile.

title: Build Plot Twist flow
description: Plot Twist subphases (e.g. after round 3): interstitial, input, reveal, animation, winner, reaction. No timers; advance on Continue or equivalent.

title: Build TTS for dater and narrator
description: TTS for dater lines and for Plot Twist text (and optional phase intros).

title: Build dater expressions / portraits
description: Expression service and dater portraits/expressions driven by emotion/sentiment. 2D for now.

title: Document from-scratch architecture and flow
description: Match → Date (6 rounds) → Wrap-up; no timers; dater-only speech; debug menu; where dater data and LLM live.

phase: B1 – Match screen and dater selection
title: Add Match screen to vibe-coded demo
description: New screen before the date: show today's dater with picture, age, gender, occupation, 1–2 hobbies. Single button: Start date. Insert in flow (e.g. after entry, before live-date).

phase: B1 – Match screen and dater selection
title: Add debug menu to select from 5–6 daters
description: Dev-only (or feature-flagged) menu to choose which dater is "today's" date. Use existing daters.js; ensure one dater is selected for the session.

phase: B1 – Match screen and dater selection
title: Wire "today's" dater into existing date flow
description: Ensure the dater chosen on Match (or via debug) is the one used in LiveDateScene; no lobby/room required for this path.

phase: B2 – Date flow: 6 rounds, no timers
title: Change date to exactly 6 rounds
description: Refactor LiveDateScene so the date has exactly 6 rounds (question → answer → dater reaction). Keep existing cycle/phase logic but fix round count to 6.

phase: B2 – Date flow: 6 rounds, no timers
title: Remove all phase and plot-twist timers
description: Remove or bypass phase timer, starting-stats timer, plot-twist timer, etc. Progression is turn-based: submit → dater reacts → next round (or Continue).

phase: B2 – Date flow: 6 rounds, no timers
title: Advance rounds on reaction done (no countdown)
description: When dater's reaction is done (and optional Justify if shown), advance to next round without waiting for a timer.

phase: B3 – Game-asked questions and player text input
title: Add pool of Date Questions and game-asked prompt
description: The game (not the dater) asks a "Date Question" each round. Add a pool of questions; pick at random (or by round index). Display as system/narrator text.

phase: B3 – Game-asked questions and player text input
title: Add player text input for date answers
description: In the date flow, let the player type their answer (mobile keyboard) and submit. Replace or supplement current wheel/choice-based input for the main date loop. Mobile-first.

phase: B3 – Game-asked questions and player text input
title: Wire player text to dater reaction pipeline
description: On submit, send the player's text to the existing dater-reaction pipeline (LLM, compatibility, sentiment). No avatar line in the UI.

title: Remove avatar speech from date flow
description: Avatar never speaks in the date. Remove or stub getAvatarDateResponse and any avatar dialogue in LiveDateScene. Only the dater has spoken lines.

title: Keep dater LLM and Justify
description: Keep existing dater response pipeline and Justify mechanic; ensure only dater lines are shown. Justify: one follow-up from player, dater reacts again.

title: Update date scene UI: question + text input + dater reply
description: Layout in LiveDateScene: Date Question visible, text input for player, dater reply and portrait/expression. Suited for mobile.

title: Match screen stats from dater profile
description: Age, gender, occupation, hobbies, picture on Match screen sourced from selected dater in daters.js.

title: Document daily flow in vibe-coded demo
description: Short doc: how to run "daily" path (Match → Date 6 rounds → Wrap-up), no timers, dater-only speech, debug menu.

title: First-person 3D café scene (portrait, mobile)
description: Three.js: first-person view at café table facing dater, portrait mode, mobile-web friendly.

title: 5–6 hand-crafted 3D dater models
description: Distinct 3D models per dater; no procedural art. Clear visual identity per character.

title: Dynamic dater reactions in 3D
description: Drive 3D dater animations from conversation (emotion/sentiment). Replace or augment 2D expressions.

title: Integrate question/input UI into 3D
description: Date Question + text input + dater reply overlay or in-world; polished for non-dev playtest.

title: Daily rotation (or seed) for today's dater
description: In production, determine "today's" dater by date (rotation or seed). Debug menu still overrides for dev.

title: Replayability: randomized traits per dater
description: Optional: per-dater randomized traits (e.g. hobbies, quirks) for variety; core personality fixed.

title: Polish for playtesting
description: Final pass on readability, touch targets, and flow on phone.

title: Stretch: 3–5 attribute-triggered effects
description: Optional in-scene effects from attributes (e.g. camera, tint).

title: Character sheet template
description: Define structured character sheet template (personality, quirks, conversation style, triggers) for tool output and game consumption.

title: LLM prompt pipeline for character generation
description: Build prompts + pipeline: seed attributes or example character → LLM → full character sheet matching template.

title: Seed input: attributes or example character
description: Support input as seed attributes and/or rough example; normalize for LLM and template.

title: Standalone, reusable character-gen tool
description: Package as standalone, modular tool (CLI or small app) for use beyond Bad Date; document usage.

title: Quality bar: consistency across characters
description: Iterate on templates and prompts for consistent, high-quality output; add validation or review checklist.

title: Art pipeline: attributes → visual brief
description: Pipeline from character attributes (Deliverable 2) to visual brief for art (portraits, expressions).

title: Generate character visuals (portraits/expressions)
description: Implement or integrate generation of visuals from brief; scope TBD (2D vs 3D, style).

title: Modular, reusable art pipeline
description: Make pipeline modular and reusable; document inputs, outputs, iteration workflow.

title: Quick iteration workflow for character art
description: Support fast iteration (change attributes → regenerate/tweak assets); document workflow.
